intro: Archimedea pyramidalis, commonly known as the pyramidal sea anemone, is a marine cnidarian belonging to the family Actinioidea. It is characterized by its distinctive pyramidal shape and vibrant coloration, often displaying shades of red, orange, and yellow. This species thrives in shallow tropical waters, typically found on coral reefs and rocky substrates. Its tentacles are equipped with cnidocytes, specialized cells used for capturing prey and defense. Archimedea pyramidalis plays a role in marine ecosystems by contributing to the biodiversity of reef environments.
